Description: Fragment of papyrus written with black ink with demotic text; clay seal attached. Thompson's MS Catalogue (numbered as 10076 C): "fragment with beginnings of 11 ll. of a letter or report addressed to Amenhotep son of Amen[hotep?]". On the right in the photograph.
Cultures/periods: Ptolemaic ((date suggested by Thompson's MS Catalogue, possibly the reign of Philometor?))
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) ((site suggested by Thompson's MS Catalogue))
Curator's comments: Published by Depauw, The Demotic Letter (2006), 29 with bibliography. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (46854) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/46854)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Clay seal Transferred to horizontal storage 30 DEC 94 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: plastazote Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir John Gardner Wilkinson
